title: Vice President Biden to Travel to Brussels to Consult with NATO Allies | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




March 03, 2009

 



Vice President Biden to Travel to Brussels to Consult with NATO Allies




THE WHITE HOUSE   Office of the Vice President  _______________________________________________________________________________  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE                                  March 3, 2009    Vice President Biden to Travel to Brussels to Consult with NATO Allies Washington, DC -- Vice President Biden will travel to Brussels, Belgium next week to meet with the North Atlantic Council, the principal forum for NATO’s 26 member states.  The purpose of his trip is to consult with allies on Afghanistan and Pakistan and to ensure that their views help inform the strategic review ordered by President Obama.  The Vice President also will meet with NATO’s Secretary General, with senior leaders of the European Union and with officials of the Belgian government. Additional details of the trip will be released at a later date.
